title: Miscellanous
text: graph’s title descriptive sentence ends period. Subtitles additional annotation provided needed. Titles 12PT Calibri Bold gray (HEX#666666) appropriate emphasis colors appropriate.

title: Miscellanous
text: Decimal points included unless absolutely necessary. data can rounded whole numbers without losing important detail. Include one two decimal places level precision needed. scales package can use round data accordingly : percentages : Adjust accuracy parameter needed :
code: scales::number(5.2578, accuracy = 1) #> [1] "5" scales::percent(0.678, accuracy = 1) #> [1] "68%" scales::number(5.2578, accuracy = .01) #> [1] "5.26"

title: Miscellanous
text: Data labels required interpretation included. Extraneous ones deleted. Focus attention removing redundancy. Data labeled directly, avoid legends. Position data labels near data rather separate legend (e.g., top next bars next lines). Data labels least 10 pt Calibri Light gray (HEX #666666) Option 1: points lines, please select important one using gghighlight package :  Option 2: lines, can compute label put end  Option 3: can use ggtext package label title :
code: mtcars |> rownames_to_column(var = "car") |> ggplot(aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) + geom_point() + gghighlight::gghighlight(mpg > 30 | hp > 250, label_key = car) + theme_omni() iris |> ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(se = FALSE) + geom_text( data = iris |> group_by(Species) |> summarise(x = max(Sepal.Length), y = max(Sepal.Width)) |> ungroup(), aes(x = x, y = y, label = Species), nudge_x = .1, nudge_y = .1 ) + scale_color_omni_discrete() + theme_omni(show_legend = FALSE) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' library(ggtext) iris |> ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + geom_point() + labs(title = str_glue("All points for setosa,versicolor and virginica.")) + scale_color_omni_discrete() + theme_omni(show_legend = FALSE) + theme(plot.title = element_markdown(colour = "darkgrey"))

title: Miscellanous
text: Data ordered intentionally. data, means sorting values arranged largest smallest. Keep mind, however, ordering data can unintentionally diminish responses underepresented groups. Avoid :  Use forcats::fct_reorder() reorder data according continuous variable :
code: mtcars |>    rownames_to_column(var = "car") |>    mutate(cyl = as.character(cyl)) |>    ggplot(aes(x = car, y = mpg, fill = cyl)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   coord_flip() +   scale_fill_omni_discrete() +   theme_omni() mtcars |>    rownames_to_column(var = "car") |>    mutate(cyl = as.character(cyl),          car = fct_reorder(car, mpg)) |>    ggplot(aes(x = car, y = mpg, fill = cyl)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   coord_flip() +   scale_fill_omni_discrete() +   theme_omni()

title: RMarkdown Template
text: installed package, access new custom RMarkdown template. can create new RMarkdown document uses OMNI template way ’d normally make new RMarkdown document: go File > New File > RMarkdown.  However, first method force make new folder put files , kind annoying. ’ve created function gets around . Just load omni package using library(omni) type new_omni_report(). default, function creates new RMarkdown document called report.Rmd, can change anything want. can also enter argument function change way. example, type new_omni_report("snazzy-report") ’ll get RMarkdown file called snazzy-report.Rmd. ’ve created new project, look bottom right pane new RMarkdown document.

title: RMarkdown Template
text: knit report, RStudio create HTML PDF version report.

title: RMarkdown Template
text: create new RMarkdown document ’ll see bunch custom fields YAML. Please fill .  knit document, fields used populate first non-cover page report. bunch stuff YAML may look confusing . Please just leave everything works correctly!

title: RMarkdown Template
text: ’ll need make sure add titles figures, charts, tables. , use fig.cap chunk option. ’ll also need include special bit code help template know whether code chunk producing figure, chart, table (thus label number correctly). figure, example, ’d add .extra='data-prefix="Figure"' code chunk. substitute “Chart” “Table” appropriate code chunks. examples default content RMarkdown template.

what: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
title: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
text: omni_colors() enables pull colors directly OMNI palette. Choose one following options: Gray, Medium Gray, Dark Gray, Dark Blue, Medium Blue, Light Blue, Teal, Orange, Tan. use function follows: omni_colors("Dark Blue") returns hex value OMNI Dark Blue.

title: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
code: omni_colors(   colors_sub = c("Dark Blue", "Medium Blue", "Light Blue", "Teal", "Orange", "Tan"),   variations_sub = "0" )

title: Function to extract OMNI colors as hex codes — omni_colors
text: colors_sub color colors want return - vector variations_sub Variation, default 0 - vector
